page.title: 06AGRICULTURE(ext.pastoral)
page.content: Although,as already stated,dairying and intensive pastoral farming are the main types of agriculture here,extens_ ive pastoral farming of sheep does ta_ ke place commonly here where there is higher land with thinner soil,as the western side of the area has,on the slopes of Sweeney Mountain(although there are examples of sheep farming, even on better land,to the east).This is due to the inability to use machin_ es on these higher pastures;and hence little ability to improve the land. Both the wool and the mutton are sold.The sheep are shorn in May or June;washed in August(to prevent skin and fleece problems);the lambs weaned in September(or earlier or later,dep_ ending on when they were born).
